title: JD Vance Sworn in as 50th Vice President with Constitutional Succession Authority
summary: JD Vance is sworn in as the 50th Vice President of the United States by Justice Brett Kavanaugh, placing him first in line of presidential succession under the 25th Amendment. At 40 years old, he becomes the third-youngest VP in history and the first Millennial generation VP, with constitutional authority to invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment with Cabinet support to remove a sitting president.
